meanings.def: a large number of cases of a particular disease or medical condition happening at the same time in a particular community
examples: the outbreak of a flu epidemic
An epidemic of measles broke out, and over 200 children died.
Effectively, tobacco companies will be exporting an epidemic of smoking-related diseases, the campaign suggests.
Over fifty people died during the flu epidemic last winter.
The worst flu epidemic for 14 years is sweeping the country.

meanings.def: a sudden rapid increase in how often something bad happens
examples: A recent report describes an epidemic of crime in the inner cities.

meanings.def: occurring more and more frequently in a particular place
examples: Car theft is now reaching epidemic proportions.
Marriage breakdown in the West has reached epidemic proportions.

meanings.def: with large numbers of cases occurring at the same time in a particular community
examples: Obesity has reached epidemic proportions in this country.
